website_summaries.verdict: This hopper provides the best mix of capacity, price, and durability on the market. Good height basket for convenience.
pros: Should hold up to 80 tennis balls
Closure bars at the top keep balls in place during transport
Offers down legs position for dispensing and up handle position for easily picking up loose balls
Easy to use for extended periods of time
cons: Assembly is a bit of a hassle
Longevity of the basket is a question mark

customer_reviews.title: An honest Review
customer_reviews.text: I've had an opportunity to use this Carrier at least 10x since purchase. For the money I don't think you can find a better deal on Amazon. The two primary concerns I read were on lack of instruction on how to put it together and the amount of balls it can hold. It took me roughly 15min to put it together; instructions could be better but very simple to figure out just looking at the box. Now the carrier claims it can hold 80 balls....it can if you hand place each one in the carrier; Real world application it holds around 65. Fits nice in the car, sturdy, lightweight and picks up balls with Ease. Great product.
customer_reviews.author: Reza

customer_reviews.title: The Good: Very light
customer_reviews.text: The Good: Very light, easy to assemble, and the clips to hold the handles in place are excellent. I have used this 10 times or so and really like the way it picks up balls and then I can transition to the upright position to feed balls. The not so good: The screws to assemble the Ballport are too short and started coming out within a week. I had to purchase 1 inch replacement screws and rubber washers to fix it. I still recommend this as a good buy.
customer_reviews.author: Sterling P. Dare

customer_reviews.title: Best Hopper at this price point
customer_reviews.text: I teach tennis - and have gone through 3 wired hoppers in 2 yrs - they are so awkward in many ways: dig into shoulder when you carry them, the handles always slip out of their slots, the bolts magically unscrew themselves and I lose them on court, they collapse easily. I don't know why I didn't try this earlier, but I'm glad i have now - so much sturdier - it takes a little longer to set the legs up and close as you have to pull them out and over a ridge, but this is worth it as it is precisely this that makes it more stable. Am loving this! Nice and light too
customer_reviews.author: Cluckadoodledoo

customer_reviews.title: Works well. Super sturdy. Made playing tennis so much better!
customer_reviews.text: My wife and I started playing tennis and we found it super annoying to have to bend over and pick up the countless number of balls that would be littered after we ran through our batch. We were pretty bad, too, so we'd empty out our old duffel bag pretty quickly. This Ballport made picking up the balls so much easier and faster. Of course, as we played more we started to get better and we'd take longer to get through the balls but still, this Ballport is super useful and we bring it with us everytime we play.
customer_reviews.author: Everymang

customer_reviews.title: i absolutely love this hopper
customer_reviews.text: i absolutely love this hopper. really lightweight compared to metal ones. picks up balls easier cuz of the rolly bars on the bottom, and you dont' have to worry about a weld coming off, thus losing the functionality. Plastic is way better imo. Only downside, is that is a little more difficult to pour balls from this hopper into a ball machine, but that is definitely not a deal breaker. highly recommend this to anyone. update, still works great 3 months later. easily, very easily, transitions from ball basket, to ball hopper. I LOVE IT.
customer_reviews.author: Keith Shirley

customer_reviews.title: Good But Could Be Improved
customer_reviews.text: I have had this item for over 2 years and use it several times a week. The price likely makes it the best option. However, the same as other reviewers have noted, the hopper does not hold 80 balls (I am not sure how many it does hold - maybe 70 max), which is fine; and plastic construction and the torque from use will result in the too-short screws coming loose constantly. I have lost nearly all them, but luckily had some longer screws (longer being like 4x as long) to replace them and these hold fine (I am still missing one screw on the top that does not really affect use).
customer_reviews.author: Mark Y.

customer_reviews.title: Great ballport! Does the job well.
customer_reviews.text: I've used this ballport a few times while hitting practice balls at my local courts, and I've been impressed with the quality of this product. The ballport is light yet seems very durable and sturdy. I'm easily able to pick up balls by pressing down on the ground. The stand works reasonable well. It took me about 20 mins to figure out how to put in together. I currently have about 20 balls in the ballport and plan to add more soon. It does appear to be able to hold about 80 as stated. I wouldn't hesitate to get this item for yourself if you are a coach or want to hit some serves on your own.
customer_reviews.author: Shaun

customer_reviews.title: Holds a lot of balls, isn't heavy, and works well for practice
customer_reviews.text: I've used this for appox. 100 practices and it's held up well. It's much lighter than similar metal baskets, so it's easier to carry to/from the car and around the court. The rotating bars on the bottom work well for picking up balls. The locking bars have held balls in place even when the basket is tipped over in the trunk. The only drawback is the skinny handles, which means it's not the most comfortable feeling when carrying on your shoulder.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Bought because of weight and very pleased
customer_reviews.text: This was bought because of its light weight. Was able to assemble in under 10 minutes. Not sure how well the screws will hold over time due to the plastic construction, but can replace with nuts and bolts as suggested by someone else. Due to desire to have a lighter basket, have not tried to put 70-80 balls in, but filled basket about 1/2 full and works well. No issues with picking up tennis balls.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice Ball Stand
customer_reviews.text: The bar hopper was easy to assemble. I like that you can flip at the legs over to make it into a ball stand. We use it as a ball stand and a ball hopper. However, we usually use it more as a ball stand. We have a second hopper made out of metal that we used to pick up balls. The metal bar hoppers are more durable, but they do not typically flip over to make a stand.
customer_reviews.author: Sharon C

customer_reviews.title: Well Designed and Works Good
customer_reviews.text: The instructions are confusing. If you use logic to assemble stuff, apply it here. Some reviews claim its not sturdy. I'm picky, the product is fine. I added 63 balls and it could hold a few more. I'm satisfied with product.
customer_reviews.author: BeFamousVideo

customer_reviews.title: Better than I expected.
customer_reviews.text: When I read the previous reviews, most people were happy with the product, but there were several mentions that because it was made of plastic, that it would not last too long. I have had metal tennis ball baskets and this one is much more steady and nicely braced when I am set up to practice serving. The balls slid easily through the holes into the basket, and store easily in the trunk of my car. The plastic is a heavy duty plastic and feels very sturdy. If it's good enough for Pete Sampras, it's good enough for me.
customer_reviews.author: Danny Quaranto

customer_reviews.title: Not what it says
customer_reviews.text: This is not a tennis ball hopper. It is a Pickleball hopper. A Pickleball is slightly larger than a tennis ball, not much bu enough to make a difference. The hopper is placed on the ball, which is then squeezed between two bars. It will then not fall out. Well, in theory it will not fall out. Since the bars in the Pickleball hopper are further apart than the bars in a tennis ball hopper, it does not take much for a tennis ball to fall out of the bottom of a Pickleball hopper.
customer_reviews.author: Walled Witman

customer_reviews.title: It's OK
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use, and picks up balls perfectly. Two replacement rods were included, and I haven't had to use them yet, and I've been using this for three years now. I have had to replace the screws that hold the plastic parts together, as the plastic wears out over time and use. Drilling holes through, and using screws with nuts solved the problem.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Large capacity!
customer_reviews.text: This thing is great! First hopper we’ve ever had, but I researched them and am happy with our decision to buy this one. It was easy to put together. It holds tons of balls. It collects them easily and none ever slip out. It sits up high when used as a stand. Everything about it is great. The only thing that would be cool to add, is an optional cover as the thing sometimes falls over when in my car trunk and the balls go everywhere. I now wrap a bag over the top to keep that from happening during transport.
customer_reviews.author: L. Piper

customer_reviews.title: ... the quality of the plastic and metal handles seem good. Especially for the price
customer_reviews.text: I haven't been on the court with it yet but the quality of the plastic and metal handles seem good. Especially for the price, I think the quality is fine. The directions aren't very good but it is easy enough to wing it. There are eight screws for the corners to hold the sides together. Two of the eight screws didn't stay in. It feels like it's because the hold part is stripped. The screws wouldn't hold. We found some longer screws that seem to work. Hopefully they'll hold.
customer_reviews.author: Cons

customer_reviews.title: Great for beginners
customer_reviews.text: I’m new to tennis. If you’re playing with someone who maybe doesn’t want to stop playing to chase after errant balls, get this hopper. The metal handles move quite easily to go from a standing position to one that’s easy to hold while collecting balls. Despite being plastic, it feels sturdy. The various bolts haven’t loosened yet despite frequent use. I would recommend to anyone!
customer_reviews.author: BuyAllTheThings

customer_reviews.title: very effective ball hopper
customer_reviews.text: This ball hopper works great! The legs/handles are sturdy and don't fall off. It picks up the tennis balls easily. I'm not sure it would hold 80 balls, I have 30 in it and it's half way full but I don't have 80 balls to test it with. It worked so well we bought another one, one for my side of the court and one for my husband's!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Hard to pick up balls in edges of court
customer_reviews.text: This is lightweight and legs secure into place so no falling over. The only downfall for me is because of the thicker sides, it’s almost impossible to get the balls that are in the corner and edges of the court. You’ll have to move them out with your feet to pick them up. Otherwise I think it’s better than the Wilson.
customer_reviews.author: Jill Goodman

customer_reviews.title: just used for the first time and really like it. Directions are very basic
customer_reviews.text: just used for the first time and really like it. Directions are very basic, and found the picture on the box more helpful than the written ones. Especially helpful on the end panels which can go either way as far as which is the top and bottom. It makes a difference the handles won't go the right way. Don't make a mistake putting panels together since it is a hard plastic and snaps together and very hard to take apart without breaking it. Seems like it will hold up well
customer_reviews.author: Jules

customer_reviews.title: Overall I'm Happy
customer_reviews.text: Overall I'm Happy Pros : It's Light + The Height is Right for my 12 year old daughter She has Fun collecting the Balls Cons : Adults 5'-8" and taller will have to bend a little It won't hold 80 Balls Balls occasionally drop from underneath the basket so when walking to or from court I ask my daughter to walk behind me so we don't Lose any balls. Yesterday I noticed we were missing 5 Screws so I replaced them with Longer Screws and hopefully that will take care of balls dropping from the basket. So my Tip is to go with Longer Screws from the Start. Overall happy with Price & quality
customer_reviews.author: Tony Azarm

customer_reviews.title: Great product...even better customer service
customer_reviews.text: Product is perfect for all uses especially those of you looking to leave it in your car trunk. Installation was a breeze and balls stay well in the hopper even after a bumpy car ride. What was even better was the customer service from the manufacturer! Always a bonus when you know the company will do right by their customers!
customer_reviews.author: fas

customer_reviews.title: Great hopper that's easy to assemble. Only flaw to me is that it does not realistically hold 80 tennis balls. More like 50-60.
customer_reviews.text: I felt this was really easy to assemble, and I haven't had any problems with it and I've been using it diligently since I bought it. The reason for the lack of one star is that it says it holds 80 balls. This _might_ be true if you stack them perfectly, however, when you just throw them in there or by picking them up by pressing them in there (works really well by the way) you can fit about 50 balls. I could probably get another 10 balls in there but if I put 30 in there it would be overflowing. Otherwise great hopper for a great price.
customer_reviews.author: tobbeo

customer_reviews.title: HIGHLY RECOMMEND THIS ONE!
customer_reviews.text: I never dreamed I would find a hopper this good for this price on my first try. I've used other people's hoppers with less satisfaction. So far, it's a dream to use. It takes a minute to strap it (full) to my bicycle back rack, drop my rackets and backpack in the front basket, and, good to go. The rollers are very well constructed, making picking up the balls extremely simple for me. The snap in locks to keep the basket upright or to use as handles are working very well. Putting money aside for another.
customer_reviews.author: FunnyLittleFingers

customer_reviews.title: Easy to assemble.
customer_reviews.text: This hopper is so easy to assemble and takes less than ten minutes. The hardest part is turning the Phillips screwdriver. The overall weight is acceptable even with around 40 tennis balls inside. Picks up the tennis balls like a champ. Glad I finally bought one. I’ve accumulated so many tennis balls in the back of our SUV.
customer_reviews.author: Scorpion E

customer_reviews.title: The best hopper on the market
customer_reviews.text: I tried 3 other hoppers. None of them worked as well as this one. It functions properly. Easy to change the legs from sitting to standing. The movable bars are clutch. Just a well designed product. Only downside is that the hopper definitely does not carry 80 balls comfortably despite the title. Comfortably, you'll probably fit 60.
customer_reviews.author: Josh

customer_reviews.title: Teaching kids to play tennis? this is a must.
customer_reviews.text: Cool product. We are teaching our daughter to play tennis. The way you can just set this on top of the balls on the ground and go through into the hopper is great then you can flip the hopper around to use it as a basket to serve.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Ballport that works great!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great tennis ballport. I have been using it everyday now for a little over two weeks. It is lite and functions as it suppose to. friends have commented how easy it is to pock up balls. Easy instructions.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Torres

customer_reviews.title: Build quality not there
customer_reviews.text: I assembled this ball carrier but never used it because it just seemed cheap and not built to last. A couple of the screws didn't even tighten down into the plastic (should have used small bolts w/ threaded inserts), the side panels were plastic (o.k.) but not very straight. I couldn't imagine this carrier holding up over time, so I returned it.
customer_reviews.author: crichhawk

customer_reviews.title: Easy to put together. Looks nice. Keeps balls in place and picks them up well
customer_reviews.text: My only complaint is that when you put the legs in place to prop the basket up, it is a little difficult to disengage them for when you want to go harvest the balls. I like the wire baskets much better.
customer_reviews.author: Allen Hall

customer_reviews.title: Well made and light weight.
customer_reviews.text: I have used a metal one for so long. Because of the shape (smaller on the base than the opening), it constant fell over in the car. The handles didn't always stay closed and I found it cumbersome to pick up balls. A friend was using this one and I knew I had to have one. Checked Amazon and the price was actually cheaper than the metal one. I have used it continuously for the past month and am very satisfied with it. It is well made and works flawlessly. I would recommend it to anyone looking for a tennis ball carrier.
customer_reviews.author: JCR

customer_reviews.title: Woudl buy a traditional wire ball hopper
customer_reviews.text: My old metal wire ballport fell apart after 10 years of use, Then I bought this one after reading the reviews. It takes 30min to put it together because the plastic panels are not perfect flat. Pros: It looks good and compact. I can carry it on my bike. Cons: 1. When using Gamma Quick Kids tennis balls, sometimes balls escape from the bottom. 2. This port is kind of short, about 6 inch lower than my old one when standing up. So I need to bend to reach the ball at the bottom.
customer_reviews.author: john d

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight, good value, wish it had wheels
customer_reviews.text: It’s nice and lightweight but it does not have wheels like the other Tourna hopper I have and I didn’t notice that until after I assembled it. I like it but wouldn’t buy again without the rolling balls to transport it so I don’t have to carry it.
customer_reviews.author: GivingBack

customer_reviews.title: The screws that hold it together keep it pretty solid, and the leg swinging "mechanism" also seems ...
customer_reviews.text: The main body of this hopper is plastic, which seems a little warped from either manufacturing or shipping. The screws that hold it together keep it pretty solid, and the leg swinging "mechanism" also seems very solid. I worry that over time the plastic will wear versus the metal cage hoppers that are more commonplace. So far it is great though, holds plenty to satisfy your serving practice needs. The ball "retrieving" feature of this works very well.
customer_reviews.author: Sean Lawlor

customer_reviews.title: Arrived broken
customer_reviews.text: it took me a while to open it so it was my own fault for not calling the company but one of my metal pieces was bent. I still use it so it's not a bad product but quite a few people had the same issue.
customer_reviews.author: Taylor353

customer_reviews.title: Great hopper! Best $$ spent
customer_reviews.text: By far the best money spent. Use this thing all the time. Totally versatile with switching from stand yo hooper. Everyone who sees this wants asks me where I purchased.
customer_reviews.author: Rich

customer_reviews.title: Great for tennis ball storage
customer_reviews.text: We use this for our puppy who loves tennis balls . Helps keep them from being all over the house. We had to put a piece of cardboard in the bottom though to keep them from falling through .
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It works but the design has a flaw
customer_reviews.text: The assembly is straightforward and took me 10-15 minutes. No extra tool other than a screw driver is needed. The biggest issue is that the porter does not stand firm and can easily collapse, especially when the porter is fully loaded. The groove on each side that holds the meta handle in position is too shallow and as the result it could easily slip out of its lock position. Will be nice to have some sort of manual/physical lock mechanism.
customer_reviews.author: Lily

customer_reviews.title: The best budget tennis hopper on Amazon
customer_reviews.text: I tried the Wilson one first, and WOW what a piece of junk. This, on the other hand, is extremely portable, well built, and sturdy. Once you've put this thing together, it will never let you down. Can't recommend this enough!
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: Far superior to the Wilson hopper
customer_reviews.text: I have both this hopper and the Wilson 75 ball hopper, this one doesn't look like it but it's actually better in every way. More durable, less likely to rip up your legs or car interior, easier to transition to the standing position... it's just all around better. Get this one instead or be disappointed
customer_reviews.author: The Hungry Mexican

customer_reviews.title: Ok ok
customer_reviews.text: This product does not looks that durable. The metrication fo assembling is poor however it's not that difficult to assemble it. I am sure that Pete Sampras has nothing to do with this ball port. Not sure how the company managed to get the name on this product. Should be ok for normal usage and as a starter kit.
customer_reviews.author: Kams

customer_reviews.title: Not the greatest for transporting in car to courts.
customer_reviews.text: This came with a broken piece in the corner, we still put it together, it’s study and we live with it. It’s not fun to get every other item damaged from Amazon. Also, the metal bars don’t collapse so it’s awkward to transport. On the court it does the trick. (On its side balls roll out... when transporting bc the stands are too long)
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good product but the screw connector system is designed for needless obsolescence
customer_reviews.text: Basically a very good product (highly functional at a low cost), but the screw/connector system is so flawed (the plastic doesn't secure the screws well) that I have downgraded it a full two stars. This is my second purchase of the product due to lose screws/connectors that get lost, and I'm surprised the manufacturer hasn't corrected this easily fixable flaw in its design.
customer_reviews.author: Jonah

customer_reviews.title: Would be great if screws didn't loosen on weak plastic
customer_reviews.text: Mostly works well, although the screws at the bottom end don't sit well for very long due to the plastic loosening/weakening. This leads to the screws popping out or loosening, making it so that balls will sometimes drop out. The plastic eventually weakens to the point where its impossible to retighten the screws, so another solution is needed to fix this.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel

customer_reviews.title: Kind of wobbly but good price
customer_reviews.text: The hopper was good enough for its cheap price, it isn’t necessary bad it just isn’t the best. It’s kind of wobbly when you have it standing up and the metal handles don’t always stay on, but overall it’s fine. Assembly was a little hard at first because the pieces wouldn’t snap in place, but it was fine in the end.
customer_reviews.author: Karlie

customer_reviews.title: Great and Great Price
customer_reviews.text: This is a great ball hopper for the money. I didn't realize it was plastic when I purchased it so I was a bit skeptical when I took it out of the box and began to assemble it. Putting it together was very easy and it turns out to be very sturdy once all the screws are in. It picks up balls very well which is what it's designed to do.
customer_reviews.author: A. Garner

customer_reviews.title: Very strong
customer_reviews.text: This is my first hopper so I have nothing to compare to. It is strong, and I expect it to last a very long time. Most the previous reviews have done justice to this hopper. It picks balls up easily and is stable on the ground. The instructions it came with wasn't great but the picture on box can help you assemble it so do not discard the box before you are done putting it together. Another issue is that it is shorter than expected. I am 5ft 10in but I feel it should have been a bit taller. The producers should take this into their future plans. Six to twelve inches taller would be great.
customer_reviews.author: OB

customer_reviews.title: I love the legs/ stand arms
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this ball hopper to use for days when the girls want to play tennis at the high school courts. It's light weight, but strong. The plastic bucket makes it much easier to pick up the balls, with out banging your shins on a metal ball hopper basket. I love the legs/ stand arms. They make the basket just the right height for pulling balls out to feed. A very good product for any tennis family.
customer_reviews.author: Grateful Mama

customer_reviews.title: Nice Ball Holder for the Practice Court!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this ball holder for a friend who is learning to play tennis. So nice to have a ball holder to take out on the practice court instead of having balls in a bag or bucket. She put it together quite easily. Seems well made and functional.
customer_reviews.author: Rene G

customer_reviews.title: Easily carries a full load of BASEBALLS
customer_reviews.text: Outstanding--I use it to hold BASEBALLS, much heavier than tennis balls. The legs are very sturdy and the crate easily stays balanced. No, I never picked up the baseballs through the bottom of the crate. In fact, I use a small bungee to hold the bottom tight so the baseballs don't fall out. It's been very durable, and when the legs are swung around to become handles the thing easily carries a full load of baseballs (same volume of baseballs as tennis balls, but baseballs are bigger, so maybe 60?) Makes me look intelligent on the ball field.
customer_reviews.author: Old dad

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: Easy to assemble. Well made. Picks up pickleballs with no problem. Legs rotate and click into place. Very sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: FatherOfHam

customer_reviews.title: It is made of sturdy plastic. I have metal hopper too and this ...
customer_reviews.text: It is made of sturdy plastic. I have metal hopper too and this plastic one picks up balls easier without any other problems.
customer_reviews.author: Paul L

customer_reviews.title: Hey quality product that exceede my expectations
customer_reviews.text: We this for pickleballs and not tennis balls. We have found it to be very durable and handy to use during our practice sessions. Because of the difference in size between a pickle ball in tennis ball, we do not use it to pick up balls. However, we knew that initially and therefore we're not disappointed. It is definitely a goodbye for the money. I would've expected to pay more for it.
customer_reviews.author: Diane M. Spencer-Herro

customer_reviews.title: Great little ballport for the price - works as advertised
customer_reviews.text: Recently got back into tennis and bought this and a bucket of practice balls. I'm pleasantly surprised at how well this works for picking up balls and as a stand. It is a basic, no frills alternative to more expensive versions but I've found it to be a great value.
customer_reviews.author: Arlingtonian

customer_reviews.title: Great sturdy ball carrier
customer_reviews.text: I have only used this for a week but I loved it from the first day. The wind was blowing so hard that my balls on the court were blowing sideways but when I looked back at the Ballport - which was empty at the time - it wasn't even moving. I found it easy to put together and love that the legs lock in both positions but are easy to slip out of their position to move to the next. I would like to see if it were possible to make it so the bars that keep the balls from falling out at the top could move easier but it is a very minor point.
customer_reviews.author: V. Cook

customer_reviews.title: It is a really nice tennis ball carrier
customer_reviews.text: It is a really nice tennis ball carrier. I had quite a few and so far this one is the best. I like the plastic design which makes it light and looks good. It is really easy to carry with no ackward angles. Legs fold up in one and snap in place which makes. I like that is snaps either when standing or for carrying. Also no more flapping top as two metal bars easily slide to side for ball access.
customer_reviews.author: Bojan Kalajdzic

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: It is a very good . I have wire based Hopper but it is heavy weight. This is a plastic structure, it means light weight . You will be happy with this Hopper
customer_reviews.author: hyun shin

customer_reviews.title: Cheap and Flimsy
customer_reviews.text: Construction of this product was somewhat frustrating. The side panels were very warped and this made it difficult to snap them in place. The warped side panels also make the thing look weird. The components that make up this product are extremely cheap and flimsy. Of course you get what you pay for and it is only $15. I will definitely look to upgrade to a better product in the future and will not get a Tourna product.
customer_reviews.author: UABTripp

customer_reviews.title: I liked the old metal ones better
customer_reviews.text: I grew up playing tennis and back then, you just had the heavy metal ones or the aluminum ones. I like this ball hopper but I definitely think that the plastic ones like this one aren't as easy to pick up balls. It does work, don't get me wrong. But there's a certain quality feel that the metal ones have that can't be replicated by these plastic ones. Overall I'd still recommend, but I'd personally troll craigslist and see if you can find a sturdy metal one instead.
customer_reviews.author: B. Kim

customer_reviews.title: and works fine. Easy to put together
customer_reviews.text: Bought for use with Pickleballs, and works fine. Easy to put together, it is light and works fine. Sometimes, the handles don't stay locked in place when fetching balls. The lip at the bottom inhibits picking up balls against a fence; you have to move the balls away from the fence.
customer_reviews.author: CG2052

customer_reviews.title: For the price this hopper is a pretty decent value
customer_reviews.text: For the price this hopper is a pretty decent value. I had a little trouble putting it together correctly and had it upside down for a while to where I had to remove the bars at the top to access the balls. Once I got that figured out I have been pretty happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Michael H.

customer_reviews.title: This is my fourth purchasa of this Ballport. It ...
customer_reviews.text: This is my fourth purchasa of this Ballport. It services four lobster machines kept in different locations. The machines fire away eighty or more balls between the two of us. Pickup time is cut at least in half with my pair of Ballports wherever we go. The assembly is the only drawback, but overcome once you follow a set of logical directions.
customer_reviews.author: exizoner

customer_reviews.title: But I was able to add on some standard casters from the hardware store and we are good to go now
customer_reviews.text: Works for all sizes of tennis balls - from the red quick-start balls up to standard tennis balls. After purchasing, I wished I had gotten the version with wheels to make it easier to take to the courts. But I was able to add on some standard casters from the hardware store and we are good to go now.
customer_reviews.author: Apex Family

customer_reviews.title: Not good quality...
customer_reviews.text: A small plastic part came off when I was assembling.... once assembled, it is very tough to take apart in pieces. So I can’t return or exchange either.. I don’t know how long it’s gonna hold up...
customer_reviews.author: YH

customer_reviews.title: Pretty sturdy and love that it stands up if needed ...
customer_reviews.text: We have used this hopper for about 6 months now. No issues at all. Pretty sturdy and love that it stands up if needed so I can run drills for my daughters. Only issue is the wheels are sold separately and I cant find them anywhere to purchase???
customer_reviews.author: J. B. Williford

customer_reviews.title: Broken. Cheap plastic
customer_reviews.text: It was delivered today broken. This is never a good sign on how sturdy the item is. Never used.
customer_reviews.author: JJB

customer_reviews.title: Simple Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: It's simple and easy to use - The instruction for the assembly is terrible - this is the only reason why I didn't give 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Frank Dong Kyu Choi

customer_reviews.title: Decent for the price
customer_reviews.text: Decent, but since it's made of plastic the first couple I ordered last about 1 year of heavy use. I ordered another one again because overall I did like them, but I think the next basket I order will be made of metal. It's a toss up to me as the metal ones rust, but at least you can spray them with some rustoleum or other paint. This just ended up in the garbage.
customer_reviews.author: Greg B.

customer_reviews.title: OK, But...
customer_reviews.text: Works okay. Picks up balls well, the legs works well to form a stand. It does hold 80 balls which is a plus. But, the inner lip around the top opening along with the rods make poring the balls into my ball machine hopper difficult. Some balls always hang up and get away when I shake it or use my hand to clear them. I have used metal ones that are easier to pour. It's not a deal-breaker, but it can be annoying.
customer_reviews.author: OppositeLock

customer_reviews.title: these just fit better, everywhere - in the car
customer_reviews.text: My wife teaches tennis all year round and carries tennis balls in the car. Before we bought these basket's the old trapezoidal ones didn't fit well into the back and tipped over all the time. Now, these just fit better, everywhere - in the car, in the garage and on the court. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: R U A DAD?

customer_reviews.title: Not too shabby
customer_reviews.text: While I am quite certain that Pete Sampras would not be caught dead with one of these, I find it quite useful. It is not great workmanship (the moving parts do not move smoothly) but it picks up balls and holds balls effectively. That is why I bought it! It was easy to put together. It fits nicely in my trunk. I have used it 4 or 5 times so far and I hope to use it for years to come. It has met my expectations. Based on the overall value (decent product for low price), I think it earns 4 stars -- but don't expect too much.
customer_reviews.author: Holland

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for practice, and quick and easy cleanup
customer_reviews.text: A great basket for holding your tennis balls, at a good height to reach for practice serving. It's a great feature that the legs reverse and become handles, and you can drop the basket on top of balls on the ground and they will squeeze in through the grates, so you don't have to bend over to pick up every ball. Sturdy construction, and very convenient!
customer_reviews.author: Rivendell

customer_reviews.title: Light, easily assembled,
customer_reviews.text: Nice light ball carrier. The only thing I wish was that it was a little easier to control the balls when pouring them out of the top. I pour them into a ball machine and they often fall off to the side because the ridge along the top end will hold the balls in until it's at a sufficient angle to get them to come out. I can't say that any other ball carriers do much better...so I'm very satisfied with it.
customer_reviews.author: GaryS

customer_reviews.title: Poor shipping and poor manufacturing
customer_reviews.text: This is a cheap product. I have had three shipped until I have one that is somewhat usable. These were well made when they first came out but the panels are warped, rods come out, and it an embarrassing mess of tennis balls with the slightest bump. I had one good one and the others are junk. If you get this, prepare yourself for many returns until you get a good one. Even a good one will require some duct tape and then melt the plastic to make it work the way it is intended.
customer_reviews.author: JT

customer_reviews.title: Great gear for practice
customer_reviews.text: Easy to assemble. Light weight. Works good. Like this not to bend over so much. This makes picking up balls at the end really easy.
customer_reviews.author: Jungnim Lee

customer_reviews.title: Great product, liight
customer_reviews.text: Great product, liight, works exactly as described, seems durable. I like the dual functionality via flipping the handles up or down to hold or pick up balls, and the sliding bars on top to keep balls in hopper during transport. I haven't been concerned whether it holds exactly 80 balls or not, and don't care. Great price, I highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth Shafarman

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality
customer_reviews.text: Poor quality. It was broken in only one week. I only used it twice.
customer_reviews.author: V K

customer_reviews.title: Well made
customer_reviews.text: Use it all the time very sturdy and fits lots of balls
customer_reviews.author: Jeff Newkirk

customer_reviews.title: Ballport works
customer_reviews.text: Ballport works well. It is easier to pick up balls with than its metal relatives. Pros are its lighter,and the balls enter thru the bottom easier, easy access to the balls and easy closure. Cons are it tends to twist and I've had top bars come out and the legs are misaligning in both positions. Just started seeing the misalignment which is probably due to the more flexible construction materials. Not sure yet if this will worsen. Would be a 5 star if I wasn't concerned about long term durability.
customer_reviews.author: Windy

customer_reviews.title: Good product, definitely not a great product
customer_reviews.text: I don't like to review products "for the price"...prices change but the product doesn't. If I was going "for the price" I would have given this 5 stars...but I'm going with a 4 star review because the product is a little bit clunky and a little bit hard to work with. The bars that keep the balls inside of the hopper work well but they are hard to move.
customer_reviews.author: Dan Wist

customer_reviews.title: Excellent!
customer_reviews.text: Can’t comment on longevity as I did not have this long enough.
customer_reviews.author: Urmuz

customer_reviews.title: Pickleball ballport
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to load and carry and it makes a great ball holder for my PB players to practice. Price is fair and sturdy plastic cargo carrier
customer_reviews.author: EAST COAST

customer_reviews.title: Not easy to assemble
customer_reviews.text: Side panels, which are plastic, are warped did not align properly to assemble. Spent about 20 minutes and gave up.
customer_reviews.author: Don king

customer_reviews.title: Good size.  Light Weight.  Work Great!
customer_reviews.text: This has worked well! It's not to large where it is hard to get it form the car to the court. It's also great a picking up all the tennis balls. My 11 year old daughter can work this on her own with no trouble. We have used it for several months now and I don't see any wear and tear. I will update this review if we have an issue later. For now it's a champ!
customer_reviews.author: Gabriel Iverson

customer_reviews.title: Good caddy at a cheap price.
customer_reviews.text: Cheap and high quality. What more do you need? The top roller things push outward to make it easier to get balls out, but close so when you turn it sideways to put in a car, the balls don't come out. Very nice.
customer_reviews.author: Carl

customer_reviews.title: Lightest ballhopper in town, and it has wheels for rolling!
customer_reviews.text: I got this as I practice tennis alone a lot (serving, with a ball machine, etc) and I wanted something to help me pick up all the balls I hit all over the court. The Tourna Ballport has been fantastic so far. Lightweight, sturdy, and I love that it has wheels that allow me to roll it from my car to the court.
customer_reviews.author: Ario K.

customer_reviews.title: Works for baseballs
customer_reviews.text: Needed something to hold balls, easy to carry, high so I didn't have to bend over pitching BP, and works to pick up balls...this thing is perfect! Great design!
customer_reviews.author: Eric

customer_reviews.title: strongly recommended
customer_reviews.text: I bought two of these when teaching my kids to play tennis. One basket is used to teach the kids, and the other basket is used rotated through the kids to pickup the balls when the "lesson basket" is half empty. That way, I have a never ending supply of balls during practice while also keeping the court clean and safer. Excellent product that works as advertised. In fact, buy two like I did to increase practice time otherwise wasted on picking up balls or transferring balls from basket-to-basket.
customer_reviews.author: Neutralist

customer_reviews.title: this is the best design I have seen for a ballport
customer_reviews.text: this is the best design I have seen for a ballport. Easy on the back, does not fall apart nor rust like those metal ones. When i take my group tennis lessons, all my classmates struggle to pick up the balls and look over at me, not bending over, picking up a bunch in one fell swoop, not trying to balance the balls on my racket. Great design!!
customer_reviews.author: R R.

customer_reviews.title: If you are looking at this just go ahead a purchase it.
customer_reviews.text: This thing has been very helpful. Surprisingly sturdy (resilient?) product. Honestly upon receiving and putting this product together you are probably going to be quite underwhelmed but this thing just keeps on ticking and doing all the things that it is supposed to do. I can't think of a way to make this product better.
customer_reviews.author: Local Man

customer_reviews.title: It works without a problem.
customer_reviews.text: This ball holder works better than Wilson we had much better. I will definitely recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great ball basket
customer_reviews.text: I've had a couple of wire tennis ball baskets in the past and this blows them away. It is light weight and I like how the legs "snap" in place whether in the "up" or "down" position. I've been using mine for a couple of years now. It resides in the trunk of my car and is on the courts every 1 - 2 weeks. I've had no problems with it and it still looks as good as new.
customer_reviews.author: j

customer_reviews.title: the plastic flimsy and expanded too wide easily, thus the bar at the bottom will get ...
customer_reviews.text: The handle is too short, the plastic flimsy and expanded too wide easily, thus the bar at the bottom will get out of the hole to hold it, the ball will fall out of the basket, I had 2 before, and was better built
customer_reviews.author: Henry

customer_reviews.title: Terribly quality
customer_reviews.text: Great design, would have liked to have loved this product BUT it broke on its first usage. Plastic side cracked from swinging and securing its legs in place. I like that it's lightweight but not if it's going to break straight away. Will be replacing with a metal ball hopper...
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Seems great. I'm using it with those large red and ...
customer_reviews.text: Seems great. I'm using it with those large red and yellow kids balls. They cycle through bottom easily. I jut put it together and it was easy. It stands up well as a stand. I'm happy with product so far.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy Linhart

customer_reviews.title: Got two of these because they're so much better than the Gamma ball hopper at my local Academy ...
customer_reviews.text: Got two of these because they're so much better than the Gamma ball hopper at my local Academy store. The Gamma ball hopper is all metal wires but it felt so flimsy ... like it could fall apart any minute now. This hopper is plastic with metal handles, but it is sturdy and stable. I'd definitely get this one again!
customer_reviews.author: T. Vo

customer_reviews.title: GREAT VALUE ! ! !
customer_reviews.text: The legs click into place while standing, making for a more stable basket from which to grab your balls. The basket itself it strong, and sturdy, after a simple and short lived assembly. The cost is staggeringly reasonable, as well. HIGHLY recommended for anyone who likes to rip 100's of serves or run drills... :D
customer_reviews.author: Terrapinbrad

customer_reviews.title: So Much Better Than Metal Hoppers
customer_reviews.text: Works great. Picks up balls SOOOOOO much more easily than metal hoppers. Like a hot knife through butter. It is lightweight, and it doesn't rattle around when you carry it in your car. The stand is quite stable when standing up, even on gusty days.
customer_reviews.author: Anjo

customer_reviews.title: Defective product, doesn't hold 80 balls
customer_reviews.text: The description claims the basket holds 80 balls, but at that count the plastic sides flex out too much and the bottom bars are able to slip out of their grommets, at which point all of your balls fall out. Kind of demoralizing when you've just spent 10 minutes collecting balls.
customer_reviews.author: Gregory M. Hammon

customer_reviews.title: Does its job well
customer_reviews.text: Functions as described, picks up balls easily and holds a fair amount of them. Very easy to assemble so worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: MDGuy31

product_meta.title: Tourna Ballport Tennis Ball Hopper Holds 80 Balls Durable and Lightweight
product_meta.description: A great place to store your tennis balls, the Tourna® Pete Sampras Ballport® is designed to hold up to 80 at a time. It's designed with rotating handles that lock in an up position for when you need to collect or transport balls and a down position for dispensing. Rolling bars on the bottom promise simple pickup, and sliding bars on the top provide easy access.
feature_bullets: EASY PICKUP: Patented bars roll at the bottom to make it easy to lift balls into the basket, even when the basket gets full.
LIGHTWEIGHT: Weighs only 4 lbs. Up to 50% less weight than other hoppers of similar capacity.
DURABLE: Made of heavy duty polypropylene. No wires to rust, paint to peel, or welds to break.

LOCKING HANDLES: Patented handles lock in both the up and down position. No more legs flying out from underneath the basket spilling balls. Legs are secured in with a mount so the legs will never fall out.
SECURE TRANSPORT: Sliding bars close at the top provide a quick and secure closure.
PRO ENDORSERS: Endorsed by Pete Sampras and the Bryan Brothers

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
